text: "Stand on both sides of the escalator. The others will follow." LOL. Not in DC where Metro escalator riding culture is stand right-walk left. Locals have a high tolerance for tourists but stand-left is generally not, um, appreciated. https://qz.com/1572371/standing-vs-walking-on-escalators-which-is-the-right-etiquette/ … #wmata

text: A lot of these new skyscrapers are boring (see Hudson Yards). Same goes with condos they are building here in DC. And don't get me started on the new Comcast Center in Philly. Is it more expensive to build a building with some character?

text: A provocative example of transportation injustice from a university "African Americans still occasionally" call "the plantation." Not the first time a rail line has been effectively axed due to concerns about the people who might ride it.

text: Chase the bus or train? As long as you don't run along side and pound on the bus (happened every so often on my Boston MBTA bus route) or mis-time the doors on Metro (WMATA). They DO NOT re-open- is major freak out for everybody if you or your bag, foot etc. gets caught.
